metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5648 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
While investigating bug 60718, it was noticed that some calls to application listeners in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M17, 8.5.0 to 8.5.11, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.41, and 7.0.0 to 7.0.75 did not use the appropriate facade object. When running an untrusted application under a SecurityManager, it was therefore possible for that untrusted application to retain a reference to the request or response object and thereby access and/or modify information associated with another web application.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5').
